column4: i am trying to make an init.d script, and when start-stop-daemon tries to start the program it barfs "can't find config file" but when i type /path/to/program it works fine. everything is owned by root. should i change something else? note: the server says it can't find its config file, not start-stop-daemon.
i'd bet that the PATH variable that includes your config file normally isn't present in the daemon environment
i edited that line in the init.d script, though, i used /etc/init.d/skeleton
how do i do the export path thing again
i'm not sure in init.d scripts
i've just had similar issues with cron jobs
gemewitch: you could replace your normal binary with something like /usr/bin/env > /tmp/environment_vars
to get a dump of the daemon environment
or possibly specify an absolute path to the config file in the line, if the binary supports that on the command line
how do i edit permanently the environment variables
cue: there's a way to type export $PATH and have it append
you should really take a look at my link, it's your exact problem
i did, but the server is already running as the user it needs
try something like this in your script itself: PATH="$PATH:/path/to/config_file"
i did that i will test it later. thanks a ton :-)
